summary: Army and Marine Corps special operations and reconnaissance forces use free fall parachutes to navigate and covertly land in contested areas. These parachute systems have a service life of about 12-15 years. The Army and Marine Corps plan to spend about $150 million to replace their aging systems with ones better suited for their unique missions. title: Military Parachutes: Observations on Army and Marine Corps Acquisition Programs
